title: Towards a data strategy for the Fifth International Polar Year (IPY5)
content: Planning of the IPY5 (2032-33) is underway and CODATA is excited to be a member of the IPY Planning Group. CODATA has a keen interest in ensuring that IPY5 is a success and marks another step forward in data stewardship. To that end, an IPY5 Data Task Group to develop an initial data strategy for data to be FAIR, handled with CARE, and preserved with TRUST has been proposed. Read this full blog by Mark Parsons to learn more about IPY, the IPY5 Data Task Group, and ways to get involved. Read the ...
creator: Asha
sourceDescription: Committee on Data of the ISC

title: DEADLINE EXTENDED TO 3 FEBRUARY: CFP Dataverse 2026 Annual Meeting from May 12th–15th, 2026, in Barcelona, Spain
content: The website is now live – https://dcm2026.com/ -, and we have opened the Call for Papers . We invite you to submit your abstract for a presentation or poster on the conference themes by February 3, 2026. Quick links to: – Important Dates and general information: https://dcm2026.com/general- information/ – Conference themes: https://dcm2026.com/ conference-themes/ – Abstract Submission: https://dcm2026.com/call-for- papers/ We look forward to seeing you in Barcelona on May...
creator: Asha
sourceDescription: Committee on Data of the ISC

title: Disaster Risk Reduction and Open Data Newsletter: January 2026 Edition
content: The pulse of the planet The explosion of data offers new ways to understand the economy—and change what gets measured, not just how. Digital technologies are redefining how we see and manage the global economy. As Kenneth Cukier writes in Finance & Development , the earth is developing a “digital nervous system” through satellites, sensors, and AI that measure everything from deforestation and traffic to crop yields and emissions. These vast data streams give policymakers and businesses an a...
creator: Asha
sourceDescription: Committee on Data of the ISC

title: TOMORROW, 28 JAN! CODATA India National Committee and OT-ViRARe Task Group Event: FAIR and Reproducible Structural Biology
content: The upcoming workshop on “ FAIR and Reproducible Structural Biology: Methods, Workflows, and Assessment, ” brings together scientists, data experts, and policy communities to link AI for Science, FAIR data, reproducibility, and responsible research assessment. Convened under CODATA’s new Open Tools and Visitation Frameworks for Global Research Assessment Reform (OT-ViRARe) Task Group, this workshop is a thematic pre-event to the India AI Impact Summit , aiming to address How AI-drive...
creator: Asha
sourceDescription: Committee on Data of the ISC

title: Professor B. Burçak Başbuğ and Professor Virginia Murray appointed interim co-chairs of CODATA’s International Data Policy Committee
content: The CODATA Officers and Executive Committee are pleased to announce that Professor B. Burçak Başbuğ and Professor Virginia Murray have been appointed as interim co-chairs of the CODATA International Data Policy Committee (IDPC) . Burçak and Virginia are committed to advancing the work of the Data Policy in Times of Crisis (DPTC) collaboration with UNESCO, which has now reached an important stage: implementing and testing the recommendations contained in the UNESCO-CODATA Toolkit . They will also...
creator: Asha
sourceDescription: Committee on Data of the ISC

title: Read Now – Disaster Risk Reduction and Open Data Newsletter: November and December 2025 Edition
content: Glaciers to Farms (G2F) Regional Program: Advancing Climate Resilience & Sustainable Development in Central and West Asia Glacier systems in the Pamir and Tien Shan ranges are retreating rapidly; projections indicate over 50 per cent of glacier volume could be lost by 2100. This cryosphere meltdown is disrupting water cycles, threatening the livelihoods and food security of over 340 million people across nine countries. Without urgent intervention, communities risk worsening poverty, displac...
creator: Asha
sourceDescription: Committee on Data of the ISC

title: Bridging Two Worlds: Reflections from the IDW2025 Panel on Research Data and Data Science
content: At IDW2025, a group of speakers from around the globe gathered to address a long-standing problem: although data is the common currency of both research data management and data science, the two communities often work in parallel worlds —each with its own conferences, training pipelines, infrastructures, and priorities. As Christine Kirkpatrick noted in her opening remarks, this separation persists despite converging challenges around stewardship, reproducibility, education, and ethics. She fram...
creator: Asha
sourceDescription: Committee on Data of the ISC
